snippet: All sides in the dispute — Moscow, Kiev, the rebels and the West — agree that some shift of power to local governments would be a good thing. But the agreement stops there.
abstract: National 'round-table' talks seeking to resolve Ukraine's political crisis by finding formula for decentralizing power is set to begin; heart of debate will deal with question of how to reshape government and bestow more power on officials outside capital of Kiev.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Noah Sneider in Slovyansk, Ukraine; Andrew E. Kramer in Donetsk, Ukraine; Alison Smale in Berlin; Alan Cowell in London; and Andrew Roth in Moscow.

lead_paragraph: All sides in the dispute — Moscow, Kiev, the rebels and the West — agree that some shift of power to local governments would be a good thing. But the agreement stops there.

headline.main: At Center of Ukraine Talks, Degrees of Decentralizing
headline.print_headline: At Center of Ukraine Talks, Degrees of Decentralizing

keywords.value: Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe
